pullrequest.title: Tutorial on how Ignition finds resources at runtime

content.raw:
> I am not sure if this is the right place to ask for some doubts

The questions are appreciated!

> typically plugin systems also look in some hardcoded path in /usr/<something>

Do you have any examples you could point us to? I'm only very familiar with the way resources are looked up in the ROS / Gazebo ecosystem, where I believe paths like those would usually come from environment variables like `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`.

> substitute or add to all these variables also some generic IGN_PLUGIN_PATH or IGN_PREFIX_PATH that is valid for all ignition projects

We could certainly group more types of resources together. The main reason why we currently have `IGN_GUI_PLUGIN_PATH` separate from `IGN_GAZEBO_SYSTEM_PLUGIN_PATH` is that the GUI uses all plugins in its path to populate the menu though. So we just need to think of cases like that.
